maml:alert.maml:para: The parameter UnifiNetwork is now an Alias. If the UnifiNetwork parameter is used, it must(!) be the ID (network_id). This was necessary to make it a non breaking change.

Get the UniFi Security Gateway (USG) Speed Test results

maml:Description.maml:para: Start date (valid Date String) Default is now
Timeframe in hours, default is 24
UniFi Site as configured. The default is: default

Show results without modifications, like the UniFi Controller creates them
Start date (valid Date String) Default is now
End date (valid Date String), default is now minus 24 hours

Show results without modifications, like the UniFi Controller creates them
Start date (valid Date String) Default is now

maml:description.maml:para: IPv4 and IPv6 CIDR Workaround for UBNT USG Firewall Rules
IPv4 and IPv6 CIDR Workaround for UBNT USG Firewall Rules (Single IPv4 has to be without /32 OR single IPv6 has to be without /128)

Process IPv6 CIDR (Single IPv6 has to be without /128)
Existing CIDR List Object
Process IPv6 CIDR (Single IPv6 has to be without /128)

maml:description.maml:para: Creates the UniFi config JSON file
Creates the UniFi config JSON file. If no input is given it creates one with all the defaults.

maml:Description.maml:para: The login of a UniFi User with admin rights
The password for the user given above. It is clear text for now. I know... But the Ubiquiti UniFi Controller seems to understand plain text only.
Valid is http and https. default is https Please note: http is untested and it might not even work!
If you use a self signed certificate and/or a certificate from an untrusted CA, you might want to use true here. Default is FALSE
The Ubiquiti UniFi Controller you want to use. You can use a Fully-Qualified Host Name (FQHN) or an IP address.
The port number that you have configured on your Ubiquiti UniFi Controller. The default is 8443
Where to safe the JSON config. Default is the directory where you call the function. e.g. .\UniFiConfig.json
Replaces the contents of a file, even if the file is read-only. Without this parameter, read-only files are not changed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The login of a UniFi User with admin rights
The password for the user given above. It is clear text for now. I know... But the Ubiquiti UniFi Controller seems to understand plain text only.
Valid is http and https. default is https Please note: http is untested and it might not even work!
If you use a self signed certificate and/or a certificate from an untrusted CA, you might want to use true here. Default is FALSE
The Ubiquiti UniFi Controller you want to use. You can use a Fully-Qualified Host Name (FQHN) or an IP address.
The port number that you have configured on your Ubiquiti UniFi Controller. The default is 8443
Where to safe the JSON config. Default is the directory where you call the function. e.g. .\UniFiConfig.json
Replaces the contents of a file, even if the file is read-only. Without this parameter, read-only files are not changed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: Just an helper function to create a JSON config
